page.title: 01Radley and Nuneham Courtenay
page.content: General Review. 2 villages are separated by the R. Thames flowing N to S. Radley, a Civil and Ecclesiastical Parish; Nuneham Courtenay, a Civil Parish within the Ecc. Parishes of N.C. and the Baldons to the East. The communities remain independent. The land rises either side of the river valley to 100m (Windmill Hill) to the S.E., and to 75m to the N.W. in Radley Large Wood. Soils are sand, gravel and clays. Arable farming predominates, with minor "cottage industries." Main employment is in Oxford,(to N.), and Abingdon, (S.W.). Transport is enabled by the Oxford- London A423, (N. to S.E.), the 2ndary road linking Abingdon, Radley, Kennington and Oxford; the railway running N. to S.(Oxford-Didcot). The River is navigated by commercial and pleasure craft.
